definition: The Peach Blossom Fan, historical play about the last days of the Ming dynasty by Kong Shangren 孔尚任[Kong3 Shang4 ren4]
peach
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
fan/sliding, hinged or detachable flat part of sth/classifier for doors, windows etc
to fan/to slap sb on the face

sentences.english: Lee and Hou's love tragedy in Peach Blossom Fan manifests unique characteristics and implication.
sentences.chinese: 《桃花扇》中侯李愛情悲劇有着獨特的個案意義。

sentences.english: The Peach Blossom Fan story hasn't started yet, I will ring end.
sentences.chinese: 桃花扇裏的故事還沒開始，我便圈上了句點。

sentences.english: This term we're studying The Peach Blossom Fan.
sentences.chinese: 這學期我們在學《桃花扇》。

definition: Kong Shangren (1648-1718), Qing dramatist and poet, author of The Peach Blossom Fan 桃花扇[Tao2 hua1 Shan4]
Romance of the West Chamber by Wang Shifu 王實甫|王实甫[Wang2 Shi2 fu3]

Huansahji or Washing the Silken Gauze, Yuan and Ming saga reworked by 梁辰魚|梁辰鱼 from History of the Southern States Wu and Yue, 吳越春秋|吴越春秋, a popular opera subject
The Peony Pavilion (1598), play by Tang Xianzu 湯顯祖|汤显祖[Tang1 Xian3 zu3]

Stories to Caution the World, vernacular short stories by Feng Menglong 馮夢龍|冯梦龙[Feng2 Meng4 long2] published in 1624
Kunqu opera, influential musical theater originating in Kunshan, Jiangsu province in Yuan times
The Injustice to Dou E (popular drama by 關漢卿|关汉卿[Guan1 Han4 qing1])
Guan Hanqing (c. 1235-c. 1300), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧 tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan dramatists 元曲四大家
Ling Mengchu (1580-1644), Ming dynasty novelist and dramatist/also written 凌蒙初[Ling2 Meng2 chu1]
ballad tune in southern dialects, usually to sanxian 三弦 or pipa 琵琶 accompaniment
